newsletter.subject_line: Apollo Students Dazzle in Final Show

articles.content: The Apollo theater students present a final showing of their production, 'Something Rotten, Jr.' Enthusiasts have one last opportunity to enjoy this engaging performance. The presentation marks the end of the students' theatrical journey with this play, offering viewers a chance to witness their talent and dedication. The curtain rises for this last performance, showcasing the culmination of the students' hard work and creativity.
articles.headline: Final Opportunity to Enjoy Student Performance of 'Something Rotten, Jr.'

rss_post.title: It‚Äôs the last chance at 2 p.m. today to watch ‚ÄúSomething Rotten, Jr.‚Äù by Apollo theater students!

articles.content: The holiday toy drive is underway, aiming to ensure that every child in Benton County experiences a joyful Christmas morning. To participate, residents should send a private message with their email to receive an application. The deadline for submissions is set for December 7th. This initiative seeks to light up the holiday season for local families.
articles.headline: Toy Drive Initiative Brings Holiday Joy to Benton County Children

articles.content: In St. Cloud, Minnesota, coffee lovers can embrace National Espresso Day by savoring the robust flavor of espresso in various local caf√©s. From Jules' Bistro's unique lattes to District Coffee MN's cozy atmosphere and pastries, options abound. Korppi Coffee + Bakeshop offers espresso with treats, while Kinder Coffee Lab provides locally roasted blends. Copper Pony and B-Side Indie Music Cafe cater to diverse tastes, making every espresso moment memorable.
articles.headline: Celebrate Espresso‚Äôs Bold Flavor in St. Cloud Caf√©s

rss_post.title: National Espresso Day!   It‚Äôs time to celebrate the little shot that packs a powerful punch! Whether you love it straigh...

articles.content: Due to the Thanksgiving holiday, the city of St. Cloud will modify its refuse and recycling collection schedule. Residents are advised to check the adjusted timetable to ensure timely disposal of their waste. This change is aimed at accommodating the holiday and maintaining efficient waste management services for the community. It is important for residents to stay informed about these updates.
articles.headline: St. Cloud Adjusts Waste Collection for Thanksgiving

rss_post.title: City of St. Cloud, MN: Refuse/Recycling Thanksgiving Schedule

articles.content: Readers who missed the latest edition of The Monthly 742 still have the opportunity to access it. The magazine remains available for those interested in catching up on the publication's content.
articles.headline: Catch Up on The Monthly 742 Now

rss_post.title: Did you miss The Monthly 742? You can still read it! https://us3.campaign-archive.com/‚Ä¶

events.title: Youth QueerConnect
events.venue: Great River Regional Library St. Cloud
events.description: QueerConnect Youth events are designed to help connect people in the LGBTQIA+ community. For these events, middle school and high school youth are invited to join them and other area youth. They have started meeting 6p-8p once a month. These are in partnership with QueerSpace Collective.
events.event_summary: Middle and high schoolers can gather monthly for Youth QueerConnect, a welcoming LGBTQIA+ meetup at Great River Regional Library in St. Cloud. From 6‚Äì8 pm, attendees build community, make friends, and access support, in collaboration with QueerSpace Collective.

events.title: Visual Journal Jam- Heijeu Arts
events.venue: Great River Regional Library St. Cloud
events.description:
Dive into two hours of playful creativity! Bring your visual journal, share your pages, and get inspired by artists of all ages. Try out new supplies, swap prompts, and spark fresh ideas as you celebrate the adventurous, experimental side of journaling.

Presented by Heijeu Arts & The Tiny School of Art & Design with artists Heidi Jeub and Niky Studenski

For all ages, space is limited. Bring a sketchbook, and projects you‚Äôre developing. Supplies will be available to use, but bring what you love to use!
events.event_summary: A two-hour Visual Journal Jam at Great River Regional Library‚ÄìSt. Cloud invites all ages to trade prompts, test new materials, and share works-in-progress. Presented by Heijeu Arts and The Tiny School of Art & Design with artists Heidi Jeub and Niky Studenski. Space is limited; bring a sketchbook; supplies available.

events.title: From Icons to Epcot: a Folk Art Journey || Art Exhibition
events.address: 913 West St. Germain Street St. Cloud, MN 56301
events.description:
November ‚Äì December 2025

Gallery Saint Germain

‚Äì Artist Reception ‚Äì

Thu, Nov 13 ‚Ä¢ 4PM-6PM

Artist Talk at 5:30PM

Artwork Description:

This handmade bowl originated from a single log. Multiple carving, cutting and sanding techniques were used by a Norwegian artist to create this Double-Headed Dragon Bowl. The style of the bowl and the painting are typical of the Aust-Agder region. This bowl was the final piece Patti Goke submitted to earn her gold medal from the Vesterheim American Norwegian Folk Art Museum.
events.event_summary: Visitors can explore Norwegian folk art at Gallery Saint Germain, Nov‚ÄìDec 2025, with a reception Nov 13, 4‚Äì6 pm and a 5:30 pm talk. Highlights include a hand-carved Double-Headed Dragon Bowl in Aust-Agder style‚Äîthe gold medal‚Äìearning submission by Patti Goke‚Äîat Paramount Center for the Arts.

events.title: Letters to the Void: Art Exhibition
events.address: 913 West St. Germain Street St. Cloud, MN 56301
events.description:
Exhibition Description:

These works began as letters to the artist's wife, Maria, written after she passed away from cancer. In painting them, he found a way to continue speaking to her, even in her absence. Layered with words, textures, and gestures, the pieces hold the weight of grief while also tracing the persistence of love. More than memorials, they are explorations of what it means to live with loss‚Äîhow memory lingers, how silence speaks, and how art can hold conversations that words alone cannot.
events.event_summary: At Paramount Center for the Arts, an artist transforms intimate messages to his late wife, Maria, into layered canvases of text, texture, and gesture. These works navigate sorrow and enduring love, probing memory, silence, and the ways art sustains a conversation words can‚Äôt.

events.title: Joy: An Invitation to Delight || Group Exhibition
events.address: 913 West St. Germain Street St. Cloud, MN 56301
events.description:
November ‚Äì December 2025

Historic Lobby Main Level

‚Äì Artist Reception ‚Äì

Thu, Nov 13 ‚Ä¢ 4-6PM

Exhibition Description:

CMW is an independent community organization based in St. Cloud, MN which serves artists mostly within a 60+ mile radius. There is no geographical requirement to be a member. All members serve as volunteers with no compensation for labor.

CMW began as a small group of artists with a great love for the watercolor medium. From that foundation CMW has evolved to provide opportunities for interested artists to participate, meet, paint, learn, network, and exhibit their art in a variety of local, state, and national events.

Step into a space where colors and textures dance and shapes sing. JOY is an exhibition celebrating the ways happiness takes shape- fleeting sparks of light, quiet peaceful moments and bursts of exuberance that fill the heart. Through watercolor media, these works explore joy as a living presence that can surprise us everyday. Each work invites us to pause and carry more light with us when you leave.
events.event_summary: Paramount Center for the Arts presents Joy: An Invitation to Delight, a group watercolor exhibition by Central Minnesota Watercolorists in the Historic Lobby Main Level, Nov‚ÄìDec 2025. Radiant works revel in happiness‚Äîfrom hush to exuberance‚Äîand invite pause. Meet the artists Thursday, Nov 13, 4‚Äì6 pm.

events.title: Witchcraft 101: Glamour Magick
events.description:
Witchcraft 101: Glamour MagickLocation: Twin FlameTime: 6:45pm-8:30pm

 

Hosted by shop owner, Adrienne Donnel ‚Äì Step into the world of witchcraft with beginner friendly workshops. During this Witchcraft 101 series, you will explore various styles and witch types broadening your own personal practices. Indulge yourself in magick, and discover the many tools you can use to expand your knowledge of the craft.

 

Witchcraft 101: Glamour MagickIn this class you will go over day to day uses of glamour magick, and how you can use it in more than just a superficial, stereotypical type way. Most think it's all about beauty, when it's not only deeper than that, but can also be used for so much more. Glamour magick is all around you and is one of the most useful styles of magick due to how simple or how complex you would like it to be. This class is not just a discussion, but will be hands on with you making various take home items for you to enjoy!

limited spots available ‚Äì 18+
events.event_summary: Explore everyday glamour magick beyond beauty with shop owner Adrienne Donnel at Twin Flame, 6:45‚Äì8:30pm. This beginner-friendly Witchcraft 101 workshop blends discussion and hands-on crafting of take-home tools, introducing styles and practices to deepen personal craft. Limited spots; ages 18+.

events.title: Interactive Family Movie Night
events.description:
Join them for an interactive movie where you can cheer, sing, and react along with the film. 

Join then for the story of Ember and Wade, two different elements, who form an unlikely friendship in order to save Ember‚Äôs father‚Äôs shop.  Run time 109 minutes. Rated PG.

Interactive pieces & snack available while supplies last.
events.event_summary: St. Cloud Public Library hosts an interactive family film night: audiences can sing, cheer, and play along while watching Ember and Wade team up to rescue her father‚Äôs shop. PG-rated, 109 minutes. Props and snacks add to the fun, available in limited quantities.

events.title: Open Skate at the Skatin' Place
events.description: The Skatin‚Äô Place is St. Cloud‚Äôs go-to destination for high-energy fun, featuring roller skating under vibrant lights, heart-pounding laser tag battles, and a massive arcade packed with games and prizes. With bounce houses for the little ones, great music for every vibe, and cold beer for the grown-ups, it‚Äôs the perfect spot to play, celebrate, and unwind‚Äîall in one place.
events.event_summary: Skatin‚Äô Place hosts open skate with colorful lights and music, plus laser tag, a huge prize-filled arcade, and inflatables for younger kids. Adults can sip cold beer while everyone plays, celebrates, and relaxes‚Äîmaking it an easy one-stop outing for families and friends in St. Cloud.

events.title: Historical Home Tours
events.description:
In 1889, lumber and railroad magnate Timothy Foley opened the doors to his newly completed family home near the banks of the mighty Mississippi. After 135 years, and many prominent families occupying the home, a devastating fire in 2002 gutted the interior.

In 2019 the Arvig family undertook a monumental restoration to preserve the historic mansion and breathe new life into the property for generations to come. They are proud to show off the work of the restoration team of architects, designers, and craftsmen by offering tours to the public. These guided tours will give you insights into the history as well as plans for the future of the historic property.

Cost $20

All tickets are non-refundable. If you are unable to make your tour, please consider gifting your tickets to another guest. 

Please park on 3rd Avenue S and enter through the front door of the mansion.

Tours are by reservation only and limited to 12 guests per tour.

Tours last approximately 1 hour.
events.event_summary: Visitors can step inside the 1889 Foley Mansion, revived after a 2002 fire by the Arvig family‚Äôs 2019 restoration. Guided, one-hour tours share its storied past and future plans. $20 per person; reservations required; limited to 12 guests.

events.title: Fall Storytime
events.venue: Great River Regional Library St. Cloud
events.description: Join them for stories, songs and fun! Books are geared to 3 to 6 year olds but younger and older friends are welcome! No advanced registration, please check in at the Children's Desk upon arrival.
events.event_summary: Families can enjoy a lively mix of read-alouds, sing-alongs, and playful moments. The selections suit ages 3‚Äì6, yet siblings and friends of any age are invited. No preregistration is needed; simply check in at the Children‚Äôs Desk on arrival.

events.title: Letters to the Void: Art Exhibition
events.address: 913 West St. Germain Street St. Cloud, MN 56301
events.description:
Exhibition Description:

These works began as letters to the artist's wife, Maria, written after she passed away from cancer. In painting them, he found a way to continue speaking to her, even in her absence. Layered with words, textures, and gestures, the pieces hold the weight of grief while also tracing the persistence of love. More than memorials, they are explorations of what it means to live with loss‚Äîhow memory lingers, how silence speaks, and how art can hold conversations that words alone cannot.
events.event_summary: An artist transforms letters to his late wife, Maria, into paintings that converse across absence. Dense with text, texture, and gesture, these works carry grief and enduring love, contemplating memory, silence, and the ways art sustains dialogue when language falls short.

events.title: DJ Trivia at Shooters Saloon & Eatery
events.description: Join them for DJ Trivia at Shooters every Tuesday night! Trivia starts at 7pm.
events.event_summary: Test their wits at DJ-hosted trivia at Shooters Saloon & Eatery, happening every Tuesday at 7 pm. A weekly night of questions, laughs, and friendly competition.

events.title: Jason Schommer and Michael Shynes Holiday Show ‚Äì Happy Ha-Ha-Ha-lidays! What the Elf?
events.description:
A Night of Holiday LAUGHS and MUSIC!

Starring comedians Jason Schommer, Jodie Maruska, Jesse the Shrink, and musicians Katy Vernon and Michael Shynes!

Join them for an unforgettable evening celebrating the season and all its happiness, wonder, chaos and insanity with hysterical holiday themed stand-up comedy, storytelling, and special musical performances.

This is going to truly be a wild and outrageous night of non-stop laughter and holiday cheer!
events.event_summary: At Pioneer Place on Fifth, comedians Jason Schommer, Jodie Maruska, and Jesse the Shrink join musicians Katy Vernon and Michael Shynes for festive stand-up, storytelling, and spirited songs‚Äîan irresistibly chaotic, laugh-packed holiday bash celebrating the season.

events.title: Historic Home Tour & Tea
events.description:
Join them for a guided tour where you will discover captivating stories of the mansion‚Äôs past and the remarkable individuals who once called this home. After your journey through history, they invite you to relax and enjoy a delightful tea and dessert service in their beautifully restored dining room. This is a perfect opportunity to savor delicious treats while soaking in the ambiance of this magnificent home.

Price: $35

All tickets are non-refundable. If you are unable to make your tour, please consider gifting your tickets to another guest. 

Please park on 3rd Avenue S and enter through the front door of the mansion.

Call for more details or to secure your private event for groups of 10. 218-849-4650
events.event_summary: Guests explore a storied mansion on a guided tour revealing its past and the fascinating people who lived there, then linger over tea and desserts in a beautifully restored dining room‚Äîa charming chance to savor sweet treats while soaking up the elegance of a lovingly preserved historic home.

events.title: FRUITCAKE Presents: Fusion VS Kittens Game Show
events.description:
The Nakita's Kittens and Fusion Cabaret are going head to head for one night only for an audience interactive game show presented by Fruitcake. During this show, there's not only going to be pop up performances from members of your talented local burlesque and drag scene, but there will be games where YOU as an audience member will help gain your team points! Games will include classic sitcom favorites with a modern twist and plenty of theatrics, with all games being improv and performers never knowing what's coming next! Now the question is‚Ä¶ are you Team Fusion or Team Kittens?

 

-YOUR HOSTS:Nakita KatRobin Hearts

-TEAM FUSION:Dexter Maine LoveDakota HunterTy TorresA Dude Named Chad

-TEAM KITTENS:Kitt KatBergamot BriarLilith LuxureJustin Uranus

 

Doors open at: 7pmShow Starts at: 8pm

SPECIALTY DRINK MENU AND APPETIZERS AVAILABLE18+ EVENT
events.event_summary: Fusion Cabaret battles Nakita‚Äôs Kittens in a one-night, audience-powered game show with improv challenges, sitcom twists, and surprise burlesque and drag numbers. Hosted by Nakita Kat and Robin Hearts at Arroy Thai and Filipino Restaurant. Doors 7 pm, show 8 pm. Specialty drinks, appetizers, 18+.

events.title: Bingo at the Moose Lodge
events.description: Join them for bingo every Wednesday!
events.event_summary: Each Wednesday, Moose Lodge hosts lively bingo, welcoming regulars and newcomers for friendly competition and midweek fun.

events.title: Letters to the Void: Art Exhibition
events.address: 913 West St. Germain Street St. Cloud, MN 56301

Exhibition Description:

These works began as letters to the artist's wife, Maria, written after she passed away from cancer. In painting them, he found a way to continue speaking to her, even in her absence. Layered with words, textures, and gestures, the pieces hold the weight of grief while also tracing the persistence of love. More than memorials, they are explorations of what it means to live with loss‚Äîhow memory lingers, how silence speaks, and how art can hold conversations that words alone cannot.
events.event_summary: At Paramount Center for the Arts, an intimate exhibition presents paintings that began as messages to the artist‚Äôs late wife, Maria. Layered marks and text translate grief into dialogue, exploring how love endures, memory resonates, and art speaks where silence and loss leave words behind.

events.title: Open Mic Night!
events.description:
Come on out to Open Mic Night at Lost Times Tavern in downtown Sauk Rapids!

Every Wednesday night starting on October 4th!

Share your creativity and enjoy the community of the hottest local talent from 7:30 ‚Äì 10pm!

Kitchen will be open until 9.
events.event_summary: Lost Times Tavern hosts a weekly open mic in downtown Sauk Rapids, starting October 4. Every Wednesday from 7:30‚Äì10 pm, performers share the stage and the crowd celebrates local talent. The kitchen stays open until 9.

events.title: Open Mic Night
events.description:
Project 37 presents a weekly open mic at their venue, B-Side Indie Music Cafe!

Join them from 6PM-8PM on Wednesday evenings. Signups will be available at B-Side day of starting at 5PM.
events.event_summary: Project 37 hosts a weekly open mic at B-Side Indie Music Cafe, inviting performers to share songs, poems, and more each Wednesday from 6‚Äì8 pm. Day-of signups open onsite at 5 pm, welcoming newcomers and regulars alike.

wordle.definition: A rabbit, especially a young or pet one; also used as an affectionate nickname for someone.
wordle.interesting_fact: "Bunny" began as a Scottish/Northern English diminutive of bun, a dialect word for rabbit‚Äîalso used for squirrels‚Äîand by the 1600s meant ‚Äúlittle rabbit.‚Äù Its cuddly feel helped it become a children‚Äôs term and later a flirtatious one (‚Äúbunny girl‚Äù). Fun twist: as the old standard coney fell out of use (its pronunciation rhymed with a taboo word), bunny and rabbit hopped into everyday English.
